page.title: 06LITTLE EAST STANDEN FARM
page.content: The farm is north of{Great East {Standen Manor.}It has approximately 400 acres of which 100 are for letting. It is mainly a sheep farm but there are also horses and some poultry. They have{4-500}lambs a year. About spring time there are{1000}sheep on the farm. The sheep are shorn once a year about spring time. They have quite a problem with the foxes. In the winter the owner{Mr Campbell feeds the animals on hay and liquid food and in the summer they graze the fields. They do sell some animals and go to {Brickfields market.}They felt the severe winter of{1985}more because quite a few animals were ill or died because of the cold.{Little East {Standen farm}is disease-free.
